core.conversion

Interface IConversion<S,T>

  • Type Parameters:
    S - The type of the source element to convert.
    T - The type of the target element to obtain.
    All Superinterfaces:
    ITransformation<S,T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractConversion, AssociationToRContextConversion, BooleanAttributeToFAttributeConversion, ClassToFContextConversion

    public interface IConversion<S,T>
extends ITransformation<S,T>
    an IConversion generic interface defining an atomic conversion operation of a source element into a target element.

    This interface provides a generic conversion operation between model elements conforming to different metamodels (i.e. inter-metamodel transformation).

    It must be implemented by all concrete atomic metamodeling conversion classes.
    Author:
    Bachar RIMA
    See Also:
    ITransformation

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface core.transformation.ITransformation

        apply, getSource, getTarget, postTransform, preTransform, setSource, setTarget, transform
